attributes.comment:
The proposed increases in immigration fees runs contrary to any logic I can muster. The increases
only add one more issue to an already overwhelmingly complitcated situation that our elected
officials as yet seem fit to sweep under the rug.

If some form of temporary labor permit could be developed as a first step to help control our borders
and supply needed workers then perhaps this obscene influx of innocent people could be controlled
legally. The illegal aspects of the border crossings would largely stop.

The drug and "terror" issues are not directly related to the worker issue. Yet it seems our elected
officials want to construct some tinker toy tower bill that will cover all aspects.

Is it not possible for someone or group in the USCIS to develop a plan and present it to the
legislators that would address these issues for the wisest purposes rather than political reasons?
attributes.title: Comment SUbmitted By Don Wenig
